comments.raw_text: The sender says he sends mail in sent in a normal font, but I see weird characters in email.

(In reply to Donald Bock from comment #4)
> Email

Mail is sent from server to Tb with;
> Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
> Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
And, =E2=80=93 which is seen in HTML looks for me correct utf-8.
  UTF-8 (hex)  : 0xE2 0x80 0xA3 (e280a3) = ‣
    http://www.fileformat.info/info/unicode/char/2023/index.htm
    Unicode Character 'TRIANGULAR BULLET' (U+2023)
  iso-8859-1   : 0xE2 = â  0x80 = Undefined  0x93 = Undefined
  windows-1252 : 0xE2 = â  0x80 = €          0x93 = “

It looks for me next.
Original mail sender sent mail in iso-8859-1, and server properly converted data to utf-8, properly converted to utf-8 even in quoted-printable, however server doesn't change <meta> in HTML because there is no need to do it.

What is your folder property setting?
  Folder Properties/General
    Default character encoding: ????
        [ ? ] Apply default to all messages in the folder
Note:
As for "[ ? ] Apply default to all messages in the folder", Tb's default is "Unchecked". So, if it is Checked, it's surely done by you, or by who shares your Tb.

comments.raw_text:
As attached mail is properly written in utf-8, if character encoding such as widows-1252 is forced to display the mail, =E2=80=93 in HTML is shown like next.
> use lawfare â€“ the use of the legal system against an enemy in war â€“
This is normal phenomenon.

(In reply to Donald Bock from comment #7)
> How to fix this please.

Stop forcing of character encoding which shows â€™ for data in mail like =E2=80=93, if you force it by your folder properties setting, by View/Character Encoding/"character set other than utf-8", and so on.
If you don't do such forcing of character encoding at any where, check add-on's affect by Tb's safe mode(thunderbird.exe -safe-mode).
If your problem is not persistent,
   the attached mail is shown like you reported sometimes,
   but the mail is shown as expeced sometimes.
describe "Steps to reproduc problem with attached mail", please.
